data.title: Best food & service!
data.text: I took my grandchildren for something different & new.  (Grandson did not want to go, granddaughter did...so we voted, he lost!)  Yummy bread and endless,  food was delish and service was outstanding.   We definitely will go back...AND grandson said he would too.

data.title: A Hidden Gem in Gresham
data.text: Nicholas has indoor and outdoor seating in the summer.  The menu is simple consisting of salads, Kabobs and mixed plates.  The portions are large and I would suggest ordering family styles for groups and couples split an entrée and maybe add an appetizer. Every table is served to start a large flat bread, soft and tender, with a ramekin of olive oil that has been seasoned for a dipping sauces- very good!  The menu consists of traditional seasoned meats (think Gyros or Greek flavors),  The Tabuli salad is a must, fresh chopped mint, onions and tomatoes seasoned with a light oil dressings. I had a Mezza, which is a plate served with Hummus, Taziaki,  Tabuli salad, served with a beef Kabob.  Entree's run in the 12-15 dollar range.

data.title: Great food... waiter with bit of attitude
data.text: The good here is the best Greek food I've ever had!  Very fresh and authentic.  There was creative variety.  We had a group of 7 and tried lots of items.  Waiter wasn't very helpful with food descriptions and wasn't very attentive.

data.title: Fair Mediterranean food
data.text:
The food was average.  The fresh,  hot bread is a bit tasteless it needs salt I believe.  We ordered a mixed grill and it was tasty and a lot of food for one person.  The service was good and the restaurant has street parking.  

The place needs to be refreshed a bit.  The bathroom was a bit dirty.

data.title: Generous portions and very good food
data.text: I wasn't too familiar with this type of Mediterranean fare but was very pleased with it.  The service was very good too.

data.title: Good food!
data.text: The food has always been plentiful and great tasting on every visit. Although the last time the meat was a little tough. They have fresh bread that taste wonderful! It is a little pricey but the portions are pretty big. I would recommend it to anyone looking for some good Lebanese food.

data.title: Wonderful Food, Excellent Meal
data.text: We stopped by because we were in the area and this place had received good ratings from others.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and will definitely return. It was like a mini-vacation - learning about new foods, trying new things. Loved it!  And downtown Gresham was great too - lots of little shops and lots of folks walking around during a warm Friday afternoon/evening.

data.title: Great Lebanese Food
data.text: Whenever family or friends visit, this our go to spot. The portions are large, but great for sharing.

data.title: That's an expensive gyro !
data.text: The place was good when it opened , now it got way up there in price for what it is . Plus it seems a bit dirty and the staff is not that attentive , you can tell the owner doesn't come around often . It just seems like the kind of place that has rats in the basement .

data.title: LUNCH WITH FRIENDS!
data.text: An enjoyable lunch for a group of 6 old friends. The restaurant is dark with a nice traditional environment. The apps (bread and hummus) were exceptional.  All entrees were great, hot, tasty, plenty of food with good presentation. My vegetarian dish was awesome. Prices were a bit high. Our server, Nick was very personable, but was new and not familiar with the menu or the food options and his lack of training was obvious. Hot Turkish tea with mint was great!  Desserts, cheesecake and sugar donuts were wonderful topped with crushed pistachios. We will definitely return when in the area!

data.title: Great Time
data.text: We had a lovely lunch here.  Service was really good.  Food was fresh and really large portions.  Menu is very large with a ton of options for every budget and appetite.  Fresh baked pita brought to every table.  Good wine and beer selection.

data.title: Consistently good, reasonable prices.
data.text: Nicholas is my favorite restaurant in Gresham. The Mediterranean menu is varied so that our group of a vegan, a vegetarian, a gluten-free eater and those of us that like meat can all coexist over a flavorful meal. We always start with the giant pita, oil and balsamic. I've had a variety of dishes over the years and have liked them all. Pleasant  staff; owner on premises.

data.title: Fantastic Lebanese food
data.text: Absolutely fantastic!  A delightful meal with a great server, who steered us to all the best menu items. Thanks to kassy for making our meal special.

data.title: Great Mediterranean food
data.text: They have a great variety of Mediterranean food. The meat mezza is my favorite. Try the mint tea. Fresh baked pita bread. Great hummus and babba ganoush. They serve lots of food so bring a good appetite.

data.title: Amazing Lebanese
data.text: This is such good food! It is consistently good. The kabobs are great, served with a yellow rice and some oil emulsified with garlic that is delicious if you love garlic, but guaranteed to give you dragon breath! I had enough food for lunch the next day. The complementary bread is a puffy flat bread that is so huge it has to be on a little raised pedestal off the table or there would be no room for it. It is served hot from the oven. They give you a yummy herb-infused oil to dip it in. Love this place!

data.title: Delicious, Gluten Free Options
data.text: Menus were very helpful for eaters with dietary restrictions--gluten free, vegan, etc.--and the food was delicious and plentiful.

data.title: Great meal on the way to The Gorge...
data.text: We were meeting up with friends at the Portland Airport on the way to a photography workshop in the Columbia River Gorge, and I had researched this restaurant on Trip Advisor.  It was easy to find and seating was no problem... When we sat down they brought a piping hot large Pita for us to dip in oil, humous  and other tasty appetizers.  We got the chicken and lamb Kabob plates which were delicious, and the deserts were spectacular.  Service was friendly, prompt, and we were well taken care of.  I will return the next time I visit Portland!!! Thanks...

data.title: Always a tasty delight!
data.text: I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. The menu is extensive.  Everyone is given a huge flat bread at the beginning of their meal.  I have  not tried their new bowl for lunch that they have added to their menu. I am looking forward to that.

data.title: Excellent Meal - Food is Superior to Service and Ambiance
data.text:
Arrived during the dinner hour and the place was packed.  We stood in line and listened to the waiter ask a group at the front of the line how many in their party.  It looked like the wait was going to be about 15-20 minutes and we were willing to wait.  After 20 minutes we were at the front of the line and the host came up and went to a cheap clip board hanging on the wall (behind customers standing in line) and called the next group to sit.  We had no idea and the placement of the clipboard was such that unless you were a regular...you would never know.  Anyway, the folks in line were very kind and let the lady know we were next because we didn't know to sign in on the wall.  

The food was the best part.  I ordered a lamb entree and it was delicious.  It was served over a bed of Jasmine rice with saffron.  Very, very delicious.  The lamb was a bit over cooked but I love lamb enough to overlook the slight issue and would still give their food 4-5 stars.

The service was rushed.  The servers had too many tables and it was rush hour.  It would generally take 5-10 minutes to get something from a server.  Regardless, the servers were kind and were working extremely hard.

I would highly recommend this place.

data.title: Food is good but service is terrible!
data.text: Food is good but service is terrible! Servers not attentive and very slow if you ask for anything. Have been overcharged by mistakes several times. We like the lamb dishes however the lamb used to be better when we first started coming. Service is so bad we've done take-out and then they charge you extra for every little thing which is normally included with the dine-in meal! By being so stinky and cheap about this they may lose our business!
